body.p:
Louisville Ky
Nov 2ond 1865
To His Excelency --
Thomas,, E,, Bramlet --
Governor of Kentucky.
Gov --

Your petitioner, Joseph Croxton would most Respectfully Represent to your Exelency that on the day of September 1865 he was fined five Hundred dollars in the City Court of Louisville Ky for dealing a game of Faro which fine he is unable to pay with-out Entailing on Him-self and Family great pecuniary Embarisment -- He Having paid $222.40/100 cost -- in the case your petitioner Hopes your Exelency will Regard that as a sufficient punishment for the offence and therefore most Respectfully asks your Exelency to Remit that portion of the fine that comes to the commonwealth --
We the undersigners, Citazens of the City of Louisville most Respectfully Requests your Excelency to Remit the find imposed on the petitioner --

W M
W. L Mitchell Agt Agt L N A & C R R
G. E. Lynn Agt L N A & C R R
B Marks
N Bassinger
Marks & Co Bankers
Louis Landau
J. J. Jones
J P Walker Esq
W. A Ronald S J C
I think Mr Croxton has paid pretty well already & do hope his Excellency the Gov May deem it proper to remit the ballance of his fine --

Lovell Rouseau
W K Thomas Jailor
H C Thomas ast Jailor

Louisville City Ct
vs
Jos Croxton
$500,
Faro
Remit
8th Nov/65
